04/18/2025,748.935(a)(2) - Individual Standards Evaluated,Individual Standards Evaluated,No,06/12/2025,06/06/2025,Individual Standards Evaluated,Medium,Yes,"A required annual training taken by staff on November 15, 2023 was not  completed in a subsequent 12-month period. Training was not completed again until April 7, 2025.","Immediate Corrective Action Taken:

column2: On 05/30/2025, a full audit of all staff training records was completed.
All overdue trainings are being scheduled and will be completed in a timely manner and or no later than 6/12/2025.

column1: Preventive Measures Going Forward:

column2: A digital training tracker will be created in Excel and integrated with calendar alerts.
Staff will now receive automated email reminders at 60, 30, and 7 days prior to the 12-month training deadline.
A monthly HR report will be reviewed by the Program Director/Administer to flag upcoming due dates and overdue items.
A Policy revision will take place by 06/30/2025 to require written disciplinary action for training overdue more than 30 days.

column1: Responsible Person(s): Case Manager, (Laquinta Banks); LCCA (Nichole Jackson)
Monitoring: Monthly training audits will begin July 1, 2025
Date of Full Compliance: 06/12/2025.

04/18/2025,748.1381(1) - Individual Standards Evaluated,Individual Standards Evaluated,No,06/12/2025,06/06/2025,Individual Standards Evaluated,Medium Low,Yes,Service plans were reviewed. Three out of six service plans were not completed in a timely manner.,Immediate Corrective Action Taken:

column2: All overdue service plans were updated and reviewed as of 05/30/2025.
A tracking system will be utilized to include separate timelines for non-treatment youth.

column1: Preventive Measures Going Forward:

column2: A new tracking calendar with automated alerts (120, 150, and 180-day marks) will be implemented on or by 07/01/2025.
Service plan deadlines are now reviewed weekly or bi-weekly during the case management staff meeting depending on the census.
Designee sign-off is required for all service plans to verify timeliness before submission.

column1: Responsible Person(s): Case Manager, (Laquinta Banks); LCCA (Nichole Jackson)
Monitoring: Weekly/Bi-Weekly service plan report review begins 06/10/2025
Date of Full Compliance: 05/30/2025.

04/18/2025,748.2151(b)(1) - Individual Standards Evaluated,Individual Standards Evaluated,No,06/12/2025,06/13/2025,Individual Standards Evaluated,Medium High,Yes,Multiple medication records were reviewed for children  in care. Medication errors were not documented until several months after the errors occurred. ,Inspection #4061552
Immediate Corrective Action Taken:

column2: Affected medication logs were corrected retroactively.
In-service training will be scheduled effective immediately to all direct care staff about the two-hour requirement.
Medication documentation responsibilities were revisited and reiterated to staff.

column1: Preventive Measures Going Forward:

column2: Clear signage has been posted in medication area(s) reminding staff of the 2-hour requirement.
As of 06/01/2025, all staff must document within 15 minutes of administration to build in a buffer.
Spot-checks by Case Manager and or LCCA will occur daily during high-risk times (mornings and evenings).
Staff non-compliance will be addressed in supervision meetings with progressive discipline.

column1: Responsible Person(s): Case Manager, (Laquinta Banks); LCCA (Nichole Jackson)
Monitoring: Daily spot-checks started 06/03/2025
Date of Full Compliance: 06/03/2025

04/18/2025,748.2003(b)(3) - Individual Standards Evaluated,Individual Standards Evaluated,No,06/12/2025,06/06/2025,Individual Standards Evaluated,Medium High,Yes,Medication directives changed to administer three times a day instead of two times a day. For dates 12/5-12/10, this medication was given twice a day instead of three times. ","completed in Follow up 4061552
Immediate Corrective Action Taken:

column2: The affected childs MAR was corrected on 12/11/2024.
A medication error report was submitted and reviewed by the Programs LCCA and parties of interest.
Staff involved were retrained on verifying MARs against current prescriptions.

column1: Preventive Measures Going Forward:

column2: Effective immediately, all updated prescriptions must be double-verified and documented by both the medication designee, a supervisor, Case Manager, and or LCCA.
The 4526 form, will be properly implemented and shared with parties of interest within 24 hours.
Bi-weekly audits of MARs will be conducted by the Case Manager, LCCA, and or designee.
Quarterly med administration refresher training will now be mandatory.

column1: Responsible Person(s): Case Manager, (Laquinta Banks); LCCA (Nichole Jackson)
Monitoring: MED Logs every Mon, Wed, and Fri as well as Bi-weekly audits begin 06/10/2025
Date of Full Compliance: 06/03/2025.
